transportAdvice: Suzhou has a metro system and an extensive bus network that connects major tourist areas including the classical gardens and historic districts, making public transit a practical option for most visitors. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available, and many garden districts are compact enough to explore comfortably on foot.

weather.description: Cold and dry with occasional overcast skies, light layers are sufficient for most days.
Still cool with increasing cloud cover and occasional light rain as winter begins to ease.
Mild spring temperatures arrive with more frequent showers and fresh greenery in the gardens.
Pleasant and warming with blooming flowers making this one of the best months to visit the classical gardens.
Warm and increasingly humid with regular rainfall, gardens are lush and vibrant.
Hot and very humid with frequent heavy rain during the plum rain season, expect wet conditions.
The hottest month with intense heat, high humidity, and heavy downpours including occasional typhoon-related rain.
Remains very hot and humid with continued heavy rainfall, outdoor sightseeing can be uncomfortable midday.
Temperatures begin to ease but humidity stays high with moderate rainfall, a transitional month.
Crisp and comfortable autumn weather with lower humidity and beautiful foliage, an excellent time to visit.
Cool and mostly dry with clear skies, ideal for walking the historic canals and garden paths.
Cold and dry with a quiet atmosphere, fewer tourists and a peaceful ambiance in the classical gardens.
